content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia

using Unicode

function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10; add_newlines=true)
    text = replace(text, "\r", " ")
    text = replace(text, "\n", " ")
    words = split(text)

    result = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        l = length(current_line + word)

        # New line if the line is over the maximum width
        # or if the line can't hold even one word
        if (add_newlines && l > text_width) || isempty(current_line)
            if !isempty(current_line)
                push!(result, replace(trim(current_line), " ", "  "))
            end
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line = string(current_line, word)
    end

    push!(result, replace(trim(current_line), " ", "  "))
    return join(result, "\n")
end

```

Example:

```
using Unicode

julia> text = """
         Is it possible to write a function which will allow
         to "wrap" a text into multiple lines such that
         no line has more than X characters.
         """
julia> wrap_string(text)
         Is it possible to write a function which will allow
         to "wrap" a text into multiple lines such that
         no line has more than X characters.
```
